publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1141 Richard Lochhead: GM Technology-That the Parliament recognises the level of public concern which exists in relation to GM technology as applied to agriculture and the urgent requirement for informed debate both within and outwith Parliament in order that the full facts surrounding the issue may be made available to the general public and policy-makers alike in an open, transparent and accessible fashion and calls on the Scottish Executive to consult with the appropriate parliamentary committee with a view to establishing an external inquiry into GM technology as applied to agriculture, charged with identifying the relevant threats and opportunities, and investigating the role of the Parliament, the remit of the Executive and other relevant bodies and committees in Scotland in relation to GM technology.
S1M-1141 GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-1141# Richard Lochhead: GM Technology-That the Parliament recognises the level of public concern which exists in relation to GM technology as applied to agriculture and the urgent requirement for informed debate both within and outwith Parliament in order that the full facts surrounding the issue may be made available to the general public and policy-makers alike in an open, transparent and accessible fashion and calls on the Scottish Executive to consult with the appropriate parliamentary committee with a view to establishing an external inquiry into GM technology as applied to agriculture, charged with identifying the relevant threats and opportunities, and investigating the role of the Parliament, the remit of the Executive and other relevant bodies and committees in Scotland in relation to GM technology. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod*, Ms Sandra White*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Irene McGugan*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Christine Grahame*, Mr John Munro*, Tricia Marwick*, Brian Adam*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1141# Richard Lochhead: GM Technology-That the Parliament recognises the level of public concern which exists in relation to GM technology as applied to agriculture and the urgent requirement for informed debate both within and outwith Parliament in order that the full facts surrounding the issue may be made available to the general public and policy-makers alike in an open, transparent and accessible fashion and calls on the Scottish Executive to consult with the appropriate parliamentary committee with a view to establishing an external inquiry into GM technology as applied to agriculture, charged with identifying the relevant threats and opportunities, and investigating the role of the Parliament, the remit of the Executive and other relevant bodies and committees in Scotland in relation to GM technology. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Irene McGugan, Christine Grahame, Mr John Munro, Tricia Marwick, Brian Adam, Andrew Wilson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Tommy Sheridan

S1M-1141# Richard Lochhead: GM Technology—That the Parliament recognises the level of public concern which exists in relation to GM technology as applied to agriculture and the urgent requirement for informed debate both within and outwith Parliament in order that the full facts surrounding the issue may be made available to the general public and policy-makers alike in an open, transparent and accessible fashion and calls on the Scottish Executive to consult with the appropriate parliamentary committee with a view to establishing an external inquiry into GM technology as applied to agriculture, charged with identifying the relevant threats and opportunities, and investigating the role of the Parliament, the remit of the Executive and other relevant bodies and committees in Scotland in relation to GM technology. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Fiona McLeod, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Irene McGugan, Christine Grahame, Mr John Munro, Tricia Marwick, Brian Adam, Andrew Wilson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-1141# GM Technology (lodged on 1 September 2000) Nora Radcliffe*
